OptionDisplayGroup.name: groupHardExtras
OptionDisplayGroup.Description: Distribution options for copper, tin, lead, uranium, silver, and nickel (ferrous). These will override any settings from other tabs related to these ores.

OptionChoice.name: forceExtraOres
OptionChoice.Description: Forces the other ores (copper, tin, lead, uranium, silver, and nickel) to spawn even if IC2, ThermalFoundation, or Metallurgy is not installed. Note: these ores may not be usable, but will be placed into the world.

Choice.Description: Groups of long narrow veins found about one third of the way down to bedrock. Especially common in jungles.
Small clusters of ore scattered about one third of the way down to bedrock. This is the default IC2 copper generation.

Choice.description: No copper is generated at all.
No copper is generated, and no copper symbols are available in Mystcraft ages.

Choice.Description: Groups of long narrow veins found about halfway down to bedrock. More frequent in flat grassy plains.
Rare, sparsely populated clouds of ore extending over several chunks. Found only in flat grassy plains.
Small clusters of ore scattered from bedrock about two thirds of the way to the surface. This is the default IC2 tin generation.

Choice.description: No tin is generated at all.
No tin is generated, and no tin symbols are available in Mystcraft ages.

Choice.Description: Isolated veins found about two thirds of the way down to bedrock and only sparsely filled with ore. Unusually common in devestated wastelands.
Rare, sparsely populated clouds of ore extending over one or two chunks. Can be found anywhere, but most common in devestated wastelands.
Small evenly scattered clusters of ore. This is the default IC2 uranium generation.

Choice.description: No uranium is generated at all.
No uranium is generated, and no uranium symbols are available in Mystcraft ages.

Choice.Description: Groups of long narrow veins found about one third of the way down to bedrock. Especially common in jungles.
Rare, sparsely populated clouds of ore extending over several chunks. Found only in jungles.
Small clusters of ore scattered about one third of the way down to bedrock. This is the default IC2 lead generation.

Choice.description: No lead is generated at all.
No lead is generated, and no lead symbols are available in Mystcraft ages.

Choice.Description: Isolated veins found about two thirds of the way down to bedrock. Unusually common in mountains.
Rare, sparsely populated clouds of ore extending over one or two chunks. Found only in mountains.
Small evenly scattered clusters of ore. This is the default silver generation.

Choice.description: No silver is generated at all.
No silver is generated, and no silver symbols are available in Mystcraft ages.

OptionChoice.name: hardNickelDist
OptionChoice.Description: Controls how Nickel Ore is generated

Choice.Description: Groups of long narrow veins found near bedrock. Especially common in swamps.
Rare, sparsely populated clouds of ore extending over several chunks. Found only in swamps.
Small clusters of ore scattered near bedrock. This is the default nickel ore generation.

Choice.description: No nickel ore is generated at all.
No nickel ore is generated, and no nickel ore symbols are available in Mystcraft ages.

OptionNumeric.name: hardNickelFreq
OptionNumeric.Description: Frequency multiplier for Nickel Ore distributions

OptionNumeric.name: hardNickelSize
OptionNumeric.Description: Size multiplier for Nickel Ore distributions

Choice.Description: Flat Clouds found near the surface. Only found in mesa, swamp, and jungle biomes. Distribution is significantly more CPU intensive than others, if you typically experience slow chunk gen, use Veins.
Flat veins found near the surface. Motherloads are found in mesa, swamp, and jungle biomes with veins stretching up to 200 blocks in every direction.

Choice.description: No bauxite is generated at all.
No Bauxite is generated, and no Bauxite symbols are available in Mystcraft ages.

OptionChoice.name: hardOsmiumDist
OptionChoice.Description: Controls how Osmium Ore is generated

Choice.Description: Long, narrow groups of veins found about one third of the way down to bedrock. More common in jungles and mountains.
Rare, sparsely populated clouds of ore extending over several chunks. Found only in jungles and mountains.
Small clusters of ore scattered near bedrock. This is the default osmium ore generation.

Choice.description: No osmium ore is generated at all.
No osmium ore is generated, and no osmium ore symbols are available in Mystcraft ages.

OptionNumeric.name: hardOsmiumFreq
OptionNumeric.Description: Frequency multiplier for Osmium Ore distributions

OptionNumeric.name: hardOsmiumSize
OptionNumeric.Description: Size multiplier for Osmium Ore distributions

Substitute.name: HIC2Substitute
Substitute.Description: Replace IC2-generated ore clusters with stone.
Substitute.Comment: The global option deferredPopulationRange must be large enough to catch all ore clusters (>= 32).

StandardGen.name: HardIC2CopperStandard
StandardGen.Description: Equivalent to regular IC2 copper distribution

VeinsPreset.name: CustomizedBigCopper
VeinsPreset.Description: Copper spawns in the height 30-50 range. The veins are average in length and size. Changes: 1. This is a preset. This is for defining some stuff and changing some defaults. 2. Motherlode is created, along with "Extra thin" veins at 15. 3. Then "normal" veins at 11 4. Then "thicker" veins at 6. 5. Finally, "thickest" (fixed radius of 1.8) .. Radius of 1.74-ish should be sufficient to guarantee no gaps even on diagonals. going to use a slightly larger amount just in case there is a turn at a diagonal gap. The "thickest" veins at 1 are supposed to be followable. 6. Base motherlode frequency is raised by a factor of 3. Seriously, before they were 1/100th as common as normal veins; that's kinda crazy. To put it in perspective: a given biome blob (256 blocks by 256 blocks, or 16 chunks by 16 chunks, or 256 chunks on average) would expect less than one normal vein (every 400 chunks); the base for this is every 40,000 chunks or about every 125 biomes. This should be about every 40 biomes. Still crazy rare, but no longer insane.

StandardGen.name: HardTinStandard
StandardGen.Description: Equivalent to regular IC2 tin distribution

Veins.name: TinVeinsPlains
Veins.Description: This roughly triples the chance of finding tin in plains biomes.

Cloud.name: HardTinCloud
Cloud.Description: Diffuse tin cloud filled with random, denser, pockets.

StandardGen.name: HardUraniumStandard
StandardGen.Description: Equivalent to regular IC2 uranium distribution

Veins.name: UraniumVeinsWasteland
Veins.Description: This roughly triples the chance of finding uranium in an wasteland.

Cloud.name: HardUraniumCloud
Cloud.Description: Diffuse uranium cloud surrounded by single-block "hint" veins, found mostly in wasteland biomes.

StandardGen.name: HardLeadStandard
StandardGen.Description: Equivalent? to regular IC2 lead distribution

Veins.name: HardLeadVeins
Veins.Description: Average veins in the 30-50 range; more common in deserts.

Veins.name: LeadVeinsDesert
Veins.Description: This roughly triples the chance of finding Lead in desert biomes.

Cloud.name: HardLeadCloud
Cloud.Description: Diffuse copper cloud surrounded by single-block "hint" veins, found in desert biomes.

Veins.name: HardSilverVeinsMountain
Veins.Description: This roughly triples the chance of finding silver in mountainous terrain.

Cloud.name: HardSilverCloud
Cloud.Description: Diffuse silver cloud surrounded by single-block "hint" veins, found mostly in mountain biomes.

Veins.name: HardNickelVeins
Veins.Description: Average veins in the 10-30 range; more common in deserts.

Veins.name: HardNickelVeinsSwamp
Veins.Description: This roughly triples the chance of finding Nickel Ore in swamp biomes.

Cloud.name: HardNickelCloud
Cloud.Description: Diffuse nickel ore cloud surrounded by single-block "hint" veins, found in swamp biomes.

StandardGen.name: HardOsmiumStandard
StandardGen.Description: Equivalent to regular Mekanism Osmium distribution

Veins.name: HardOsmiumVeins5
Veins.Description: This roughly triples the chance of finding Osmium in jungle and mountain biomes.

Cloud.name: HardOsmiumBiomeCloud
Cloud.Description: Diffuse Osmium cloud surrounded by single-block "hint" veins, found in jungle and mountain biomes.
